Package fr.univartois.cril.approximation.solver.state

Class AbstractState

java.lang.Object
fr.univartois.cril.approximation.solver.state.AbstractState
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISolverState
Direct Known Subclasses:
NormalStateSolver, SubApproximationStateSolver
public abstract class AbstractState extends Object implements ISolverState
The AbstractState class serves as a base class for different solver states in the approximation framework. It provides common functionalities for managing solver configurations, executing solving processes, and handling state transitions.

This class integrates with ApproximationSolverDecorator to control solver behavior and relaxation strategies, ensuring smooth transitions between different solving phases.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Maintains references to the solver, its configuration, and its context.
  • Defines the mechanism for resetting solver limits based on updated configurations.
  • Implements an internal solving mechanism that supports optimization objectives.
  • Handles timeout detection

State Transition:

Each solver state extends this class and overrides specific behaviors to dictate how the solver progresses from one state to another.

  • Field Details

    • context

      protected SolverContext context
      The shared context containing global solver configurations. This provides access to different solver configurations and helps manage transitions between solver states.

    • solver

      protected org.chocosolver.solver.Solver solver
      The solver instance.

    • decorator

      protected ApproximationSolverDecorator decorator
      The decorator that enhances the solver with additional approximation mechanisms.

    • nbRemoved

      protected int nbRemoved
      The number of constraints removed during the relaxation process.

    • pathStrategy

      protected PathStrategy pathStrategy
      A reference to the strategy for restoring constraints during the relaxation process. This strategy determines how and when constraints are reintroduced after being relaxed.

    • listener

      protected ISolverListener listener
      The listener.
